meanings.definition: To cover with a thin layer of metal
meanings.sent1: She toled the key with a shiny layer of silver.
meanings.sent2: The artist toles the frame with a coat of gold paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf toled the gnome's hat with glittery metal.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight toles the lake with a shimmering blanket of silver.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith toles the sword with a protective layer of steel.

meanings.sent1: He toles his friends to join him on the adventure.
meanings.sent2: The salesman toles customers with promises of great deals.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of freshly baked cookies toles the children into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger toles the detective with cryptic clues.
meanings.sent5: The music toles the audience to dance with its catchy beat.

meanings.definition: A type of painted or lacquered metalware
meanings.sent1: The tole on the tray gleamed with intricate floral patterns.
meanings.sent2: She displayed her collection of colorful tole pieces in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The antique shop had a beautiful tole vase on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The tole lantern lit up the room with a warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The tole teapot added a touch of elegance to the table setting.

meanings.definition: A toll or tax collected by the government
meanings.sent1: The tole on imported goods helped fund public projects.
meanings.sent2: Travelers had to pay a tole at the city gates.
meanings.sent3: The villagers grumbled about the increasing tole on their crops.
meanings.sent4: The king imposed a heavy tole on the merchants in the market.
meanings.sent5: The tole on property ownership was a burden for many families.
